function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"AI algorithms for triaging COVID-19 patients may not accurately classify patients into the three groups, leading to incorrect treatment and monitoring.","Impact":"Inaccurate triaging could result in improper care for patients and may increase the risk of spreading the disease.","Mitigation":"Validation and continuous improvement of AI algorithms through clinical feedback and data analysis. Training healthcare professionals to verify and adjust the triage decisions made by AI algorithms.","Technologies":"AI and machine learning for algorithm development, data analysis, and feedback integration.","People":"Patients with COVID-19, healthcare professionals, healthcare facilities.","Owner":"Healthcare professionals, healthcare facilities, AI developers."},{"Description":"Reduction or cessation of critical clinical services in healthcare settings can lead to delayed diagnosis and treatment of non-COVID-19-related illnesses, increasing morbidity and mortality.","Impact":"Delayed diagnosis and treatment of non-COVID-19-related illnesses could result in worsening health outcomes for patients and increased strain on healthcare systems.","Mitigation":"Developing strategies to maintain essential clinical services while managing the COVID-19 pandemic, utilizing digital technology for remote consultations and diagnostic procedures.","Technologies":"Tele-medicine, virtual clinics, digital imaging technology, e-learning platforms.","People":"Patients requiring non-COVID-19-related care, healthcare professionals, healthcare administrators.","Owner":"Healthcare administrators, healthcare professionals, technology developers."},{"Description":"Physical crowding of patients in hospital premises and physical meetings can increase the risk of disease transmission, including COVID-19.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission may lead to outbreaks within healthcare settings and the community, further burdening healthcare systems.","Mitigation":"Implementing virtual clinics, tele-medicine consultations, and remote education platforms to reduce the need for physical gatherings and minimize patient crowding in hospital premises.","Technologies":"Tele-medicine, virtual clinics, digital imaging technology, e-learning platforms.","People":"Patients, healthcare professionals, hospital staff, researchers, educators.","Owner":"Healthcare administrators, healthcare professionals, technology developers."}]}
